title: Men's Final Four predictions, previews for Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston
content: Here's how each 1-seed reached San Antonio and their key to reaching the final, plus disagreement on one game.

title: 7 ejected after skirmish between Pistons, Wolves
content: Five players and two coaches were ejected after a fight broke out in the second quarter of the Timberwolves' 123-104 win against the Pistons on Sunday.

title: Source: Tush push ban has support in committee
content: At the league meetings this week in West Palm Beach, Florida, a source with direct knowledge told ESPN that the Green Bay Packers' proposal to ban the push sneak, popularly known as the tush push, has support within the NFL's competition committee.

title: Durant exits loss with ankle sprain; MRI up next
content: Phoenix Suns forward Kevin Durant was helped to the locker room with 6:57 left in the third quarter of his team's loss to the Houston Rockets on Sunday after suffering a left ankle sprain while falling to the floor in a collision with Jabari Smith Jr.

title: Mensik, 19, shocks Djokovic in Miami Open upset
content: Phenom Jakub Mensik, 19, upset Novak Djokovic in a rain-delayed Miami Open final, keeping Djokovic at 99 career titles.

title: Rodgers still in frame as Steelers weigh QB options
content: The Pittsburgh Steelers aren't getting off the quarterback carousel anytime soon. Amid a public courtship of quarterback Aaron Rodgers, coach Mike Tomlin said Sunday that the team is still evaluating its options to add to the quarterback room.

title: Ovechkin nets 890th, now 5 goals from NHL record
content: Washington captain Alex Ovechkin, 39, is five goals from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record after scoring the 890th of his career during the third period of the Capitals' home game Sunday, an 8-5 loss to the Buffalo Sabres at Capital One Arena.

title: Auburn into Final Four amid Broome injury scare
content: Auburn held off Michigan State 70-64 on Sunday after national player-of-the-year candidate Johni Broome briefly exited with an elbow injury.

title: How UCLA, South Carolina punched their women's Final Four tickets -- and their keys to winning in Tampa
content: Half of the women's Final Four is set after 1-seeds UCLA and South Carolina won in the regional finals Sunday.

title: European soccer review: Barcelona extend unbeaten run to 20
content: Barcelona continue to cruise under manager Hansi Flick and towards the LaLiga title. That and more from around the continent in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Haaland injured as Man City reach FA Cup semis
content: Erling Haaland was substituted with a left ankle injury in the 60th minute of Manchester City's FA Cup quarterfinal match against Bournemouth on Sunday.

title: Flick feeling 'love' as Barca hit 4 goals for 20th time
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said he loves his team's thirst for goals after they scored four more against Girona on Sunday to restore their three point lead at the top of LaLiga.

title: América, LAFC could play for CWC spot, FIFA says
content: FIFA has drawn up plans to hold a one-game playoff between Club América and Los Angeles Football Club to determine a replacement team for Club León at the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN.

title: Football Australia: 'No further action' on Kerr
content: Sam Kerr has avoided being stripped of the Matildas captaincy after meeting with the Football Australia board, with the striker finally joining the Australian women's team in camp.

title: Cunha on Wolves future: 'Need to take next step'
content: Wolves forward Matheus Cunha has said that he is keen to leave the club this summer, saying he has "made it clear that I need to take the next step."

title: Rashford: First Villa goals mark steady progress
content: Marcus Rashford has pointed to his "step by step" progress since joining Aston Villa after he scored his first goals for the club on Sunday.

title: Can U.S. figure skating carry this momentum to the Olympics?
content: With less than a year until the Olympics, the world titles from Ilia Malinin, Alysa Liu and Madison Chock and Evan Bates have even more weight.

title: Hyo Joo Kim rallies to beat Lilia Vu in LPGA playoff in Arizona
content: Hyo Joo Kim rallied from a four-shot deficit Sunday with an 8-under 64 to force a playoff, defeating Lilia Vu on the first extra hole with a 6-foot birdie putt in the Ford Championship.

title: Forecasting next season for women's eliminated top seeds
content: NC State has been eliminated. From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to the Wolfpack next season.

title: Denny Hamlin gets first win at Martinsville in 10 years
content: Denny Hamlin ended an agonizing 10-year winless streak at Martinsville Speedway, holding off teammate Christopher Bell in his home state.

title: Mayer and Price are the best welterweights; now they need to fight
content: After anther victory, the only thing between Mikaela Mayer and the undisputed championship is Lauren Price.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal prefer Gyökeres over Isak
content: Sporting CP star Viktor Gyökeres is reportedly now favorite to fill Arsenal's vacant striker position. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Regulator proposes tweak in pipeline tariffs; CNG and piped gas to be charged lowest rate
content: In the new system that it now proposes, 66.17% of the unified tariff will be charged for first tariff zone and the 100% for users on either size of the zone-1

title: Kerala ASHA workers make emotional statement, cut hair in protest against 'government apathy'
content: Protest by ASHA workers enters 50th day, with demonstrators intensifying their agitation outside Secretariat, marking a new phase in their prolonged campaign

title: Clash between two communities in Bihar's Darbhanga, 6 arrested
content: According to police, the incident took place when people belonging to another community started pelting stones from rooftops at people returning from the Kalash Shobha Yatra.

title: Gen Z drives surge in Tamil Nadu’s summer travel demand
content: With a growing appetite for adventure, cultural tours, and personalised travel options, Gen Z is emerging as a key demographic for tour operators

title: IFS officer Nidhi Tewari appointed private secretary to PM
content: A 2014-batch Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer, Ms. Tewari is currently serving as deputy secretary in the Prime Minister's Office (PMO).

title: Train services resumes on Cuttack-Nergundi rail section in Odisha after derailment
content: Trains resumed normal movement at reduced speeds as restoration work continued, and speed limits will be gradually increased as the situation stabilises

title: Mirwaiz claims he has been placed under house arrest ahead of Eid prayers
content: Mirwaiz condemns barring Eid prayers at Eidgah and Jama Masjid in Kashmir, questions authorities’ agenda and motives

title: Congress seeks law for SC, ST quota in private, non-minority educational institutions
content: Congress demands legislation for SC, ST, and OBC quota in private educational institutions, citing Article 15(5) recommendations.

title: Mediclaim policy amount can't be deducted from medical expenses compensation: HC
content: The amount under a mediclaim policy is received in view of a contract entered into by the claimant with the insurance company, the court said

title: Belagavi Zilla Panchayat distributes special job cards for disabled workers
content: The 15-day drive, launched with the aim of providing financial strength to the disabled, will run from April 1 to 15.

title: Kerala YouTuber arrested for blocking convoy of Priyanka Gandhi
content: Accused allegedly stopped his car in front of the convoy, reportedly irked by honking of pilot vehicle of Wayanad MP on Saturday, say police

title: Super Cars, Reckless Hands: Noida Lamborghini Crash Adds To Alarming Trend
content: The Lamborghini Huracan that hit two labourers in Noida yesterday is owned by a YouTuber, but was being driven by a luxury car dealer considering buying the vehicle.

title: Tension At Hyderabad University Over Bulldozers On Land Next To Campus
content: Tension erupted at the University of Hyderabad yesterday after the police clashed with students protesting against the Telangana government's plan to redevelop 400 acres of land next to their campus.

title: Lamborghini Was Speeding At 300 kmph, Claims Noida Crash Injured
content: Bruised and struggling to speak, one of the labourers has narrated the moment he was hit by a speeding Lamborghini in Noida yesterday.

title: Missiles: Iran's Response to Donald Trump's "Bombing" Threat
content: Hours after US President Donald Trump threatened Iran with "bombing" over nuclear negotiations, the country has responded by "readying missiles".

title: Copy Of Ramayana, And A Request: Meerut Murder Accused Get Visitor In Jail
content: Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla, accused in the high-profile murder of Meerut's Saurabh Rajput, are in the Chaudhary Charan Singh District Jail.

title: "Attempts To Make Prithviraj Scapegoat": Director's Mother On Empuraan Row
content: Mallika Sukumaran, veteran actress and mother of actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran, has hit out at the criticism against her son amid the L2 Empuraan controversy and said some people are trying to make him a "scapegoat"

title: 4 Chinese Men Try To "Remove" Documents From Bangkok Collapse Site, Detained
content: Police in Thailand detained four Chinese nationals on Sunday for unlawfully entering the site of an under-construction building that collapsed after a powerful earthquake in Chatuchak District last week.

title: Live: Indian Disaster Force At Myanmar Monastery Trying To Rescue 170 Monks
content: The World Health Organization said the Myanmar earthquake was a top-level emergency as it urgently sought $8 million to save lives and prevent disease outbreaks over the next 30 days.

title: UP Woman's Meerut-Like 'Drum' Warning To Husband, Assault Video Goes Viral
content: A woman in Uttar Pradesh has allegedly threatened to chop off her husband's body parts and put them in a drum, in an act similar to a recent gruesome killing in Meerut.

title: All About Lamborghini Huracan Supercar Involved In Noida Accident
content: A road accident involving a Lamborghini Huracan supercar left two people injured near Noida's Sector 94 roundabout on Sunday. Following the incident, police arrested the driver, identified as Deepak, and seized the vehicle.

title: US Woman Lists 8 Reasons Why She Prefers Raising Her Children In India
content: Kristen Fischer, who has been living in Delhi for the past four years, is a mother to three children.

title: NDTV Ground Report: "Won't Give Up...", Bangkok Officials Vow To Save Lives
content: Bangkok authorities have refused to concede defeat in the race against time to rescue 78 people still trapped under tons of steel and concrete after a 33-floor skyscraper collapsed last week in tremors after the Myanmar earthquake.

title: Prince Harry Accused Of "Harassment, Bullying" By Head Of Charity He Set Up
content: In an interview, the head of the charity claimed that the Duke of Sussex initiated the campaign by the "unleashing of the Sussex [PR] machine".

title: ED search and seizure at TASMAC: T.N. govt. files amendment petition before Madras HC
content: Its plea has been listed for hearing before a Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar on Tuesday

title: Rahul Gandhi writes to PM seeking cancellation of tenders for offshore mining in Kerala, Gujarat, Andaman
content: Rahul Gandhi condemns government’s decision to allow offshore mining, citing environmental concerns and impact on marine life.

title: 163 local body wards identified as ‘water-stress’ hotspots in Kerala’s Alappuzha district
content: Study reveals that despite having a network of rivers, canals and lakes, the wards face acute shortage of water for domestic use, especially in summer months

title: Sanjay Raut ignites PM Modi successor debate; BJP refutes
content: RSS will decide PM’s successor, who will probably be from Maharashtra, says Sanjay Raut. BJP denies it

title: Woman Maoist with ₹25 lakh bounty killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh
content: The gunfight broke out at around 9 am in a forest along the border of Dantewada and Bijapur districts in Bastar

title: IIIT-A student from Nizamabad found dead at hostel premises
content: Chaitanya, despite being a deaf and mute student, had not been provided with a sign language expert, even though the college was supposed to do so under the RPwD Act, according to other students

title: Expelled BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal hints at forming new regional party in Karnataka
content: Vijayapura MLA feels the need for a regional party focused on Hindutva and development of north Karnataka

title: Ram and Baam want to incite riots in Bengal, warns Mamata
content: The Chief Minister while participating in the annual Eid-ul- Fitr prayers at Kolkata’s Red Road urged Muslim not to fall in the trap of orchestrating riots. She said if there are no riots the Opposition parties will disappear

title: Uttarakhand IAS Association passes resolution over BJP MP’s ‘controversial’ remarks on illegal mining
content: Uttarakhand IAS Association secretary Dilip Jawalkar said that they have also decided to send this proposal in the form of a memorandum to Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami

title: Delhi Assembly celebrates Hindu New Year; CM Rekha Gupta says people ‘witnessing change’
content: The event was attended by a large number of guests, the BJP government Ministers and senior party leaders besides others.

title: Woman can't be forced to undergo virginity test; violation of Article 21: Chhattisgarh High Court
content: Emphasising that Article 21 is the “heart of fundamental rights”, the High Court said granting permission for a virginity test would be against the “fundamental rights, cardinal principles of natural justice and secret modesty of a female”

title: Shiv Sena forces ‘illegal’ meat shops to down shutters in Haryana’s Sonipat for Navratri
content: On whether the action of the Shiv Sena was not illegal, Haryana Shiv Sena president Neeraj Sethi says the Shiv Sainiks had only “requested” the shop owners to down the shutters and everyone obliged.

title: What is the controversy over the Bodh Gaya temple? | Explained
content: Why are Buddhist monks protesting near the Bodh Gaya’s Mahabodhi Mahavihara? What does the Bodh Gaya Temple Act (BTA), 1949 entail? When was a Hindu temple established?

title: Asked About CSK's Poor Form, Skipper Ruturaj Gives Unfiltered Reply
content: Chennai Super Kings skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad blamed their poor starts and fielding lapses as key reasons behind their six-run defeat to Rajasthan Royals in the IPL.

title: Viral: South Korea Tourists, Rajasthan Auto Drivers And An Unexpected Twist
content: A South Korean couple traveling in India was left speechless when local auto-rickshaw drivers at a bus stand in Rajasthan greeted them in fluent Korean.

title: Sam Altman Says OpenAI Team "Needs Sleep" As Ghibli-Style AI Art Goes Viral
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has called for a pause as social media is overrun with AI-generated Studio Ghibli-style images.

title: PM Modi to flag off first Vande Bharat train to Kashmir on April 19: Jitendra Singh
content: The Jammu-Katra-Srinagar Vande Bharat Express will initially operate from Katra as the Jammu railway station is undergoing renovation

title: West Bengal BJP president stopped from visiting strife-torn Mothabari
content: The Murshidabad police district has registered two cases and arrested six persons in an incident relating to arson in Nowda area

title: Traffic advisory issued for Eid-ul-Fitr in Hyderabad
content: A large number of worshippers are expected to gather at Mir Alam Tank Eidgah near Zoo Park and Hockey Ground in Masab Tank between 7 a.m. and 11.30 a.m., which may cause moderate traffic congestion in several areas, said the advisory.

title: TeleManas helpline proves lifeline for mental health support in Telangana
content: The data, categorised into psychological issues, stress-related disorders, anxiety problems, sleep disturbances, mood-related sadness, relationship conflicts, suicidal ideation and medical complaints, highlights the growing demand for mental health interventions.

title: Man sentenced to death for killing cousin in knife attack that left 18 wounds
content: While awarding the death sentence Judge Biplab Roy, quoted from the Mahabharat, and said that the convict had attacked his unarmed brother inflicting 18 stab wounds

title: Somireddy offers his political bureau seat to youth
content: TDP’s Sarvepalli MLA Somireddy Chandramohan Reddy has offered to give up his membership in the party’s political bureau for accommodating a youth leader

title: Last date of applications for admission to Rashtriya Indian Military College extended
content: The last date of applications for admissions to Class 8 for January 2026 term at Rashtriya Indian Military College (RIMC), Dehradun, has been extended to April 15,

title: Six killed as tree falls on vehicles near Manikaran Gurdwara in Himachal
content: Medical teams, police and revenue officials are present at the spot and coordinating the rescue and relief operations, Kullu Sub Divisional Magistrate Vikas Shukla told reporters at the spot.

title: Scientists for People seeks thorough probe into Balabhadrapuram cancer cases, writes to APPCB
content: In addition to an investigation into the matter, the organisation also sought accountability for the “inaccurate” public statements made by the government officials and demanded that the gravity of the situation be acknowledged.

title: State changes from ‘rice death’ threats of BRS to free fine rice of Congress: CM
content: The CM noted that Telangana produces around 12 lakh tonnes of fine paddy, with Nalgonda district contributing 8 lakh tonnes.

title: KSINC drops plan to operate package tours from Marine Drive to Kakkathuruthu island
content: The agency cites a year-long delay by local bodies and Fisheries dept. in removing two unlicensed nets obstructing safe navigation along the waterway as the reason for not proceeding with its plan

title: Kochi’s port connectivity highway caught in delay over demand for alignment change
content: National Highways Authority of India has agreed to change of alignment, provided Cochin Port Authority hands over ₹100 crore as additional expense for the purposeose

title: Kerala Urban Policy moots public, private and people’s partnership in the future development of State
content: Kerala should develop a risk-informed master plan at the local level to integrate climate resilience into urban planning, says report

title: All flyovers on Ramanattukara-Vengalam reach of NH-66 opened to traffic
content: One side of the flyover has been opened for traffic, and the other side, where the finishing works are progressing, is expected to be opened in a few days.

title: Third eye network expands in Kozhikode to keep an eye on drug peddlers
content: Vadakara municipality has installed 20 new cameras at key locations within its limits; efforts are also under way in the municipal limits of Koyilandy, Payyoli, Mukkom, and Ramanattukara to upgrade the existing CCTV network

title: MP flags different responses to same question in Parliament
content: MP had raised a question to Ministry of Science and Technology on which was the first State to implement a science policy after Independence

title: CBI catches BIS Joint Director accepting ₹70,000 bribe
content: A case has been registered against V. Lakshminarayana Reddy alias Babu Reddy, Y. S. Manohar and others for offering bribe to a public servant

title: We are pioneering a Telangana model for the Congress, says Deputy CM Bhatti
content: The model pioneered by the Congress will ensure economic growth and social inclusion go hand in hand, and will be an alternative to the BJP’s vision, says Deputy Chief Minister Bhatti Vikramarka Mallu.

title: Police Commission suggests law to stop protests that make use of dead bodies
content: The proposed ‘Tamil Nadu Honour of Dead Body Act’ aims at to curbing agitations with unjustified demands using dead bodies

title: A point to ponder while solving the Chennai airport conundrum
content: If Chennai has to regain lost traffic, this is the best solution: demolish the bridge across the river before the next floods. The old secondary runway was working well for smaller aircraft. Build the parallel runway and use it for smaller aircraft and wide-body aircraft

title: 'Did anyone die?' asks Lamborghini driver after hitting two pedestrians in Noida, arrested
content: A purported video surfaced online showing that after the accident, a man was heard asking the accused if he knew how many people died here. To this, the accused asked the locals "koi mar gaya idhar? (did anyone die here?)" and came out of the car

title: Ugadi Mahotsavams draw huge crowds at Srisailam
content: Panchanga Sravanam (almanac reading) was held as per tradition; Traditional artisans from Kerala, Mumbai, and Karnataka, as well as folk artists, performed during the Rathotsavam

title: Annamalai says he has given BJP national leaders a detailed study on Tamil Nadu
content: On the DMK’s allegation that the Centre had not released the entire amount for MGNREGA to the State, Mr. Annamalai said Tamil Nadu received the highest of ₹39,339 crore compared with other States in the last four years.

title: 98.47% of local bodies in Kerala achieve waste-free status
content: As part of the Malinya Muktham Navakeralam campaign, the government had set March 30 as the deadline for attaining the status

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu launches  ‘P4’ initiative to eradicate poverty by 2029
content: The ambitious programme seeks to bridge the socio-economic divide by encouraging the wealthiest 10% of population to support the bottom 20% of the poorest families

title: PM Modi pitches for rainwater harvesting, waste recycling
content: Unprecedented tasks related to water conservation had been undertaken in many parts of the country, the PM said in his Mann Ki Baat address, highlighting recycling of waste for a sustainable future

title: Hold Indian Labour Conference to discuss issues of workforce, House panel tells govt
content: Maintaining that the last ILC (46th) was held in 2015, the panel says the reasons for not holding it during the last 10 years have not been shared

title: Aditya Nigam and Hilal Ahmad win Ramchandra Khan Social Science Award
content: The award selection committee said their books possessed ‘global intellectual quality, creative vision, and profound discourse’

title: Myanmar earthquake: Army team inducted at Mandalay, recce on to set up field hospital
content: Two more Indian Navy ships departed for Yangon from the Andaman and Nicobar Command in addition to the two ships dispatched from Visakhapatnam a day before

title: Volunteer rescue group saves beached whale sharks along Thiruvananthapuram city’s coastline
content: Their seasonal migration from the Arabian Sea to Australia’s western coast begins in January and concludes in March

title: Kamban is creator and father of ‘Bharatiya culture’: T.N. Governor Ravi
content: Kamban’s literary genius transcended language and region, inspiring poets and saints across India to narrate the story of Sri Rama, says the Governor at the inauguration of seven-day Kamba Ramayanam festival at Kambarmedu in Mayiladuthurai district;

title: Lamborghini involved in Noida crash belongs to YouTuber with 18.7m followers
content: A Lamborghini test-driven by Deepak Kumar, a car dealer from Ajmer, crashed in Noida Sector 94. Two construction workers were injured. The car is owned by YouTuber Mridul. Police have charged Deepak with rash driving. The incident caused outrage due to Deepak's nonchalant response. The vehicle has been seized by the police.

title: Far-Right French leader Le Pen found guilty, political career in jeopardy
content: Marine Le Pen and eight MEPs have been found guilty by a Paris court of embezzling EU public funds intended for parliamentary aides. The ruling could impact Le Pen's chances of running in the 2027 presidential election. Even if she appeals, the court can declare her ineligible for office immediately, putting her political future at risk.

title: 'Only 40% recovered': Not paying traffic fines could get driving licence suspended
content: Drivers who fail to pay their traffic e-challan fines within three months may face suspension of their driving licenses. Additionally, accumulating three challans for serious offenses in a financial year could result in a three-month license confiscation. This measure is aimed at improving the current low recovery rate of fines and ensuring better compliance with traffic laws.

title: 'RSS will pick PM Modi's successor,' claims Sanjay Raut; Fadnavis reacts
content: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut claimed that PM Narendra Modi's successor would be from Maharashtra and decided by the RSS. Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis countered, asserting Modi would continue as PM until 2029. The speculation arose following Modi's visit to the RSS headquarters. Fadnavis emphasized discussing succession while Modi is still active is inappropriate.

title: 'US will receive a blow': Iran warns of 'strong' response if attacked
content: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei warned the US of a strong retaliation if President Trump's threats of bombing are executed due to Iran's non-compliance with a new nuclear deal. This follows Trump's ultimatum and warnings of severe consequences, including unprecedented bombing and secondary tariffs on Iran. Tensions heighten as both nations stand firm on their positions regarding the nuclear agreement.

title: How to create Ghibli style art using Google Gemini for free
content: Ghibli style art has surged on social media, with users turning personal photos into the beloved aesthetic of Hayao Miyazaki's films using Google Gemini's AI. The process involves uploading a photo, crafting detailed prompts, and refining the generated image. This trend blends cutting-edge technology with the whimsical charm of Studio Ghibli's dreamy visuals.

title: Aurangzeb's tomb protected monument but won't allow glorification: Maha CM
content: Maharashtra chief minister Devendra Fadnavis has dismissed calls for the removal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb, citing its status as a protected monument while opposing glorification of the emperor. Union minister Ramdas Athawale has suggested replacing the tomb with a memorial for Chhatrapati Sambhaji. Tensions have escalated, with protests by right-wing groups and violent clashes reported.

title: Why kids, young mothers are leaving men behind in Uttarakhand's border villages
content: In Uttarakashi's high-altitude villages near the India-China border, young women and children are migrating to towns due to inadequate local school facilities. Despite economic prosperity from apple farming and tourism, men stay back to manage businesses, leading to family separations.

title: Eid Mubarak 2025: 75+ Happy Eid-ul-Fitr messages, greetings, wishes and quotes
content: Eid-ul-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and is celebrated by Muslims through prayer, charity, and feasting. Celebrations include wearing new clothes, family gatherings, special foods, and giving gifts to children. The festival symbolizes faith, purity, and togetherness and will be observed from March 31 to April 1, 2025, based on moon sighting.

title: Let my team sleep: OpenAI CEO to users making Ghibli images
content: OpenAI's Sam Altman has requested users to reduce the generation of Ghibli-style images, stressing the strain on his team. Other AI platforms such as Google's Gemini and Grok can also produce similar visuals, though the output might vary. Free options like Craiyon and DeepAI offer alternative solutions.

title: Foreign investors turn net sellers in Indian equities but boost buying in March
content: Foreign portfolio investors continued to be net sellers of Indian equities for the third successive month in March. However, a strong buying spree in the month's latter half reduced the net outflow significantly to ₹3,973 crore.

title: In numbers: Chennai Super Kings' dreadful chasing record in IPL continues
content: Chennai Super Kings have struggled with chasing high targets in IPL 2025, losing two matches out of three when tasked with 180-plus runs. They now hold a nine-match losing streak for targets over 175 runs, dating back to 2022.

title: Kerala to tackle human-wildlife conflicts with tribal wisdom
content: Forest department is compiling information from residents of over 300 tribal hamlets in Kerala as part of Mission Tribal Knowledge. The tribal knowledge will be scientifically validated and tried out in areas of conflict shortly

title: Donald Trump ‘radar-focussed’ on reciprocity, anticipate tariffs on April 2, says Mark Linscott
content: Previous trade negotiator with India says lowering tariffs, balancing trade deficit, and agricultural market access key for a US-India deal

title: UoH unrest: Students protest as bulldozers move inside campus, police respond with force
content: Students’ Union of University of Hyderabad released a statement strongly condemning the police brutality and unlawful detention of students who were peacefully protesting against the illegal encroachment of university land

title: Condition of 23-year-old female intern is ‘very critical’, says health bulletin
content: She tries to end life after accusing KIMS Bollineni hospital’s AGM of sexual assault and criminal intimidation

title: Ex-HC judge to lead committee for new medical colleges approval
content: Andhra Pradesh government appoints Justice U. Durga Prasada Rao as HPC chairman to assess and recommend new medical, dental, and nursing colleges

title: SGOU expedites steps for constructing headquarters
content: Along with an administrative block with an area of 6,000 square metres, entrance gate, compound wall, roads, landscaping, and greening will be carried out in the first phase

title: Haryana Police ban on songs promoting violence sparks controversy
content: About 10 songs have been taken down from various social media platforms over the past fortnight, and at least two concerts, including one in Gurugram, halted midway

title: Madrasa row: Crackdown and actions will continue on ‘illegal structures’ in days to come, says Pushkar Dhami
content: In a Statewide crackdown on Madrasas (Islamic schools), the Uttarakhand government has sealed over 136 such institutions so far.

title: Director, who offered Monalisa a role during Kumbh, arrested in sexual assault case
content: Delhi Police have arrested director Sanoj Mishra for allegedly raping an aspiring actress. Mishra gained attention after offering a movie role to viral sensation Monalisa during the Maha Kumbh. The arrest came after his bail was rejected by the Delhi High Court.

title: Charlie Javice, Forbes '30 Under 30' winner, may face 30 yrs for JPMorgan fraud
content: Charlie Javice, founder of student-finance startup Frank, has been convicted of defrauding JPMorgan Chase in connection with the bank's $175 million acquisition of her company. A Manhattan federal jury found Javice guilty of bank fraud for falsely inflating Frank's user base to secure the deal.

title: 'Shared commitment to strengthen ties': Pak PM Shehbaz dials Yunus in Bangladesh
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif spoke with Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus, exchanging Eid ul-Fitr greetings and reaffirming their commitment to strengthen bilateral relations. Sharif highlighted the upcoming visit of Pakistan’s deputy Prime Minister and foreign minister to Dhaka on April 22, accompanied by a trade delegation.

title: Maharashtra cooperative banks stuck with Rs 101cr demonetised notes for 8 yrs
content: Eight district central cooperative banks in Maharashtra are storing Rs 101.2 crore in demonetised currency, struggling with its safekeeping after the Reserve Bank of India refused to accept it due to late deposits. The Kolhapur DCC bank holds the highest amount, followed by the Pune DCC bank.

title: Woman Maoist killed in encounter with security forces in Bastar
content: A female Maoist was killed in an encounter with security forces on the borders of Dantewada and Bijapur districts in Chhattisgarh's Bastar division. The encounter occurred during an anti-Maoist operation, and an INSAS rifle was recovered. Previously, 50 Maoists surrendered just before PM Modi's visit, responding to ongoing appeals to eschew violence.

title: Frustrated with chaos, many in Nepal want return of king the country once deposed
content: Pro-monarchy protests in Kathmandu are growing, with thousands calling for the return of King Gyanendra amidst dissatisfaction with the political instability since the monarchy ended in 2008. People are expressing disillusionment with current leaders, leading to clashes with police and widespread unrest.

title: 'Will chop, pack you in drum like Meerut massacre': UP woman threatens to kill husband
content: A woman in Uttar Pradesh threatened to dismember her husband, echoing a recent Meerut murder case. Police received complaints from both parties, with the husband accusing his wife and her lover of assault and threats, while the wife alleges harassment and forced abortions. An investigation is underway, including examination of CCTV footage.

title: Shift from China: Foxconn to roll out 30 mn iPhonesfromIndia!
content: Foxconn plans to manufacture 25-30 million iPhones in India this year, doubling its previous output as Apple expands its presence in the country. The Taiwanese company has been conducting trial runs at its Bengaluru site, aiming to meet Apple's quality standards and production goals.

title: 'Three Cs haunt Indian education': Sonia Gandhi slams Centre over NEP
content: Sonia Gandhi has criticized the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accusing the BJP government of centralizing power, commercializing education, and promoting communal biases. She argues the policy undermines state governments, increases privatization, raises student fees, and revises educational content with ideological biases.

title: Watch: Iran unveils massive underground ‘missile city’ as regional tensions mount
content: Iran has showcased its advanced missile capabilities in an underground facility, highlighting weapons with ranges up to 1,550 miles. The display, meant as a message to Israel and the US, comes amid escalating tensions and threats of potential military action from Washington.

title: 'Dictatorship?': Akhilesh Yadav accuses UP Police of stopping his convoy on Eid
content: Akhilesh Yadav, Samajwadi Party chief, accused the UP Police of unnecessary barricading on Eid in Lucknow, deeming it as a sign of dictatorship and emergency by the Yogi government. Police forces have increased security measures, including drone surveillance and CCTV monitoring, in sensitive areas for Eid and Ram Navami.

title: Angered by honking, Kerala YouTuber blocks Priyanka Gandhi Vadra’s convoy
content: A YouTuber named Aneesh Abraham was arrested in Kerala for allegedly obstructing Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's convoy. The incident occurred at Mannuthy Bypass Junction, where Abraham reportedly stopped his car in front of the convoy, leading to his detention by the police.

title: 'Say hi to George for me': Musk to protesters who disrupted his speech in Wisconsin
content: Elon Musk criticised billionaire George Soros during a Wisconsin rally after a heckler interrupted his speech. Musk claimed the interruption was by Soros operatives. He has previously accused Soros of harming societies and criticised Joe Biden for awarding him the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Musk also financially supported the Republican candidate in the Wisconsin Supreme Court race.

title: 'Is anyone dead?': Lamborghini veers onto footpath, injures 2 in Noida
content: Police said the luxury vehicle was being driven by Deepak Kumar — a car dealer from Ajmer who was arrested later. He had come to Noida to test the Lamborghini, which is owned by Mridul, a resident of Supernova in Sector 94 and YouTuber with 18.7 million followers.

title: Explained: Tax notices for HRA exemptions & TDSissues
content: Income tax filers claiming House Rent Allowance (HRA) exemptions must ensure compliance with Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) obligations on rent payments. Non-compliance leads to penalties and interest.

title: 'Faltu ki baaten': Chirag Paswan amid talks on shutting down meat shops during Navratri
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan criticized the administrative meat ban during Navratri and Eid-ul-Fitr, labeling it divisive and unnecessary. At a National Democratic Alliance meeting, he urged political parties to avoid commenting on religious matters, emphasizing the importance of personal faith and unity. Paswan argued that resolving interference by religious and political organizations could address many existing issues.

title: Why is MS Dhoni batting at No. 9? CSK coach Fleming explains
content: Chennai Super Kings coach Stephen Fleming explained that MS Dhoni's batting lower in the order is due to his knee condition. Dhoni, valuable as a leader and wicketkeeper, cannot endure long batting stints. Fleming stated Dhoni could bat from the 13th or 14th over depending on the match situation, prioritising his key roles in the team.

title: Banks closed on several days in April - check state wise list
content: April 2025 Bank Holidays List: The RBI announces official bank holidays for April 2025 varying by state due to different national, regional, and religious festivals. Notable holidays include Mahavir Jayanti, Ambedkar Jayanti, Good Friday, and Akshaya Tritiya. Nationwide finalisation of annual accounts occurs on April 1.

title: 'Read history books not WhatsApp': Raj Thackeray on row over Aurangazeb's tomb
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray condemned efforts to create communal tensions over Aurangzeb's tomb and urged people to study history from books rather than WhatsApp. He emphasized that the country should not rely solely on religion for progress and cited Turkey as an example of successful reform.

title: IPL match today: MI vs KKR - everything you need to know
content: Struggling Mumbai Indians seek their first win in IPL 2025 against Kolkata Knight Riders at Wankhede Stadium tonight. MI faces the challenge without Jasprit Bumrah and underperforming Rohit Sharma, while KKR are boosted by Sunil Narine's return and aim to continue their winning momentum. Tonight will be the first home fixture of the season for Hardik Pandya-led MI.

title: Could Trump actually serve a third term as US President? What we know
content: Donald Trump reiterated his potential pursuit of a third term as president, challenging the constitutional two-term limit. He claimed public support for his extended service and hinted at unconventional methods to achieve it, eliciting polarized reactions from political leaders and citizens.

title: Why are BSE and NSE closed for trading today?
content: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE) will be closed on March 31, 2025, due to Eid al-Fitr celebrations. Trading will resume on April 1, with subsequent closures in April for Shri Mahavir Jayanti, Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Jayanti, and Good Friday.

title: India boosting covert warfare capabilities of special forces
content: India is enhancing its special forces' capabilities with advanced technology including nano drones, loiter munitions, and sophisticated communication equipment. The integration aims to improve covert warfare and counter-terrorism operations. Although a full-fledged Special Operations Command is lacking, efforts like the Armed Forces Special Operations Division (AFSOD) are fostering joint cooperation among different forces.

title: Nearly 200 dogs seized from ex-NFL RB LeShon Johnson in dogfighting case
content: Former NFL player LeShon Johnson has been indicted for allegedly running a large-scale dogfighting operation, resulting in the seizure of 190 dogs. He faces federal charges for possession, transportation, and sale of dogs for fighting. If convicted, he could face up to five years in prison and a significant fine.

title: IPL 2025: RR slapped with hefty fine despite first win of season vs CSK
content: Rajasthan Royals secured their first IPL 2025 win against Chennai Super Kings after two losses. Stand-in skipper Riyan Parag was fined Rs 12 lakhs for a slow over-rate. Wanindu Hasaranga's bowling and Sandeep Sharma's final-over defence were pivotal. Mumbai Indians' Hardik Pandya faced a similar penalty a day prior.

title: In first visit to RSS site as PM, Modi upholds BJP-Sangh ties
content: PM Narendra Modi commended the RSS as an enduring symbol of India's eternal culture while laying the foundation for an eye hospital in honor of Golwalkar. Emphasizing the organization's grassroots service initiatives and India's spiritual resilience, he highlighted the RSS's significant role in the country's development goals leading up to centenary independence.

title: India now 2nd-largest host of int’l schools as parents seek to future-proof kids’ future
content: International schooling in India has seen significant growth from 2019 to 2025, with a notable rise in Cambridge and International Baccalaureate programs. More families are opting for these due to personalized learning and global exposure. The sector is expanding beyond major cities into smaller towns, driven by higher incomes and aspirations for global career opportunities.

title: Trump’s tariff shock may boost Indian auto parts exports
content: The 25% tariff on auto parts and automobiles is unlikely to significantly impact India. While Indian auto part exports to the US total $2.2 billion, the uniform application of the tariff levels the playing field. The Indian government has an opportunity to boost exports amidst these tariffs.

title: Arsenal name Berta as new sporting director
content: Andrea Berta will take on the permanent role, replacing Edu Gasper . Berta has been on a six-month period of gardening leave since resigning in November . he is looking forward to playing his part in shaping a successful future with the club .

title: Bernardo: Winning FA Cup won't redeem season
content: man city beat Bournemouth 2-1 in the quarterfinals of the FA Cup . city secured their place in the semifinals on Sunday after a comeback 2-1 win . the hosts took the lead through Evanlison after Erling Haaland missed a penalty earlier in the half .

title: Fields tabbed Jets' QB1: 'We believe in Justin'
content: new: "we believe in Justin. We believe we can win with Justin," says Darren Mougey . new: he says the organization believes fields can replicate the career trajectory of Sam Darnold and Baker Mayfield . the new york Jets general manager says fields' future depends on his success .

title: Countdown to 894: The Alex Ovechkin goal-scoring tracker
content: Alex Ovechkin broke 800-goal barrier during 2022-23 season . he now has 890 goals and is one of the NHL's most popular bets . the date when Ovi eclipses Gretzky depends on his goal-scoring pace .
